feed.title: NewsTracker: hillary clinton
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: FBI looking into the security of Hillary Clinton’s private email setup
entry.summary:
"The system we used was set up for President Clinton's office. And it had numerous safeguards. It was on property guarded by the Secret Service. And there were no security breaches," Hillary Clinton said in March.

Instead, a server that had been purchased for use by Hillary Clinton's 2008 campaign was installed at the Chappaqua home.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton slams Bush on immigration, women's health
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton speaks to supporters during a campaign rally at La Rumba, a Denver dance club and restaurant, Tuesday, Aug. 4, 2015.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton slams Bush on immigration, women's health
entry.summary:
DENVER (AP) - Hillary Clinton on Tuesday repeatedly slammed Jeb Bush and the rest of the Republican presidential field over immigration and women's health during a campaign stop in Denver.

Clinton also criticized Bush for questioning the amount the federal government spends on women's health during a forum earlier Tuesday.

entry.title: Meet Hillary Clinton — Again
entry.summary: "We're going to make sure everyone knows who Hillary Clinton really is - who she fights for and what has motivated her lifelong commitment to children and families," Mook said.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton told David Cameron was 'unsure and inexperienced'
entry.summary: A key confidant of US presidential candidate Hillary Clinton told her David Cameron was "unsure, inexperienced, oblique and largely uncommitted" on foreign policy, it has been revealed.

entry.title: Amid latest release of emails, Hillary Clinton's campaign makes public tax and medical details
entry.summary:
The couple made nearly $23 million from speaking fees alone in 2013 - the year Clinton left the State Department - and collected an additional $20 million from paid events last year.

The remainder of their income came largely from book royalties and consulting fees paid to Bill Clinton.

entry.title: Clinton charity donors surge amid Hillary Clinton's campaign
entry.summary: In May, Hillary Clinton disclosed that she and her husband made more than $25 million from speeches over the past year and a half.

entry.title: Clinton charity donors surge amid Hillary Clinton's campaign
entry.summary:
A new list of donors to the Bill, Hillary and Chelsea Clinton Foundation shows a marked surge in donations and the numbers of contributors to the family charity in the first half of this year - at the same time that Hillary Rodham Clinton ramped up her campaign for the presidency.

"We know that donors are giving more because they are seeing the impact of our work across the globe," said the foundation's new president, Donna Shalala, who was accompanying Bill and Hillary Clinton's daughter, Chelsea, on a tour of foundation programs in Haiti.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton won't take a position on Keystone pipeline
entry.summary: NASHUA, N.H. (AP) - Hillary Clinton says she will not take a position on the Keystone XL pipeline until she becomes president, citing her work on the issue as secretary of state.

entry.title: Clinton offers energy plans, declines comment on Keystone XL oil pipeline
entry.summary: Hillary Rodham Clinton is detailing new energy proposals in Iowa to address climate change.

entry.title: Clinton offers energy plans, declines comment on Keystone XL oil pipeline
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton tours the Des Moines Area Rapid Transit Central Station on Monday, July 27, 2015, in Des Moines, Iowa.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton sets renewable energy goals to spur more wind, solar power
entry.summary: Clinton, the front-runner for her party's 2016 presidential nomination, also pledged to have more than half a billion solar panels installed nationwide within four years of taking office.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton Focuses On Renewable Energy In Climate Change Plan
Hillary Clinton set to testify before Benghazi panel
entry.summary:
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton speaks at a campaign event in West Columbia, South Carolina last week.

Washington: Hillary Clinton has agreed to testify before a House committee investigating the 2012 Benghazi, Libya, attacks.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton to appear before Congress on Benghazi
entry.summary:
Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton speaks Friday, July 24, 2015, at the New York University Leonard N. Stern School of Business in New York.

Hillary Clinton says she will testify this October before a public hearing of the House committee investigating the deaths of four Americans in Benghazi, Libya.

entry.title: Clinton to testify before House committee on Benghazi
Hillary Clinton’s latest e-mail mess
Hillary Rodham Clinton Emails Wanted for Justice Probe, Sources Say
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) - Two independent government investigators have asked the Justice Department to look into whether sensitive government information was transmitted through Hillary Rodham Clinton's personal email server, federal officials said Friday.

entry.title: Officials call for criminal probe into Hillary Clinton's use of email
entry.summary: The U.S. Justice Department is weighing a request by two government inspectors general to open a criminal investigation into Hillary Clinton's use of a private email account for her work as secretary of state, The New York Times reported on Thursday.

entry.title: Bill Clinton: Hillary once thought she was 'too aggressive'
Hillary Clinton on racial justice: 'Black lives matter'
Jeb Bush's Uber driver would vote for Hillary Clinton
Hillary Clinton returns to Arkansas, now behind GOP lines
entry.summary: Presidential hopeful Hillary Rodham Clinton returns for a Democratic Party fundraiser Saturday, July 18, 2015, to a state that looks dramatically different than the one where she served as first lady for a dozen years.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton returns to Arkansas, now behind GOP lines
entry.summary:
FILE - In this June 23, 2007, file photo, then U.S. Sen. Hillary Rodham Clinton, D-New York, speaks to Democrats in North Little Rock, Ark.

(AP) - As she ramps up her presidential campaign, Hillary Rodham Clinton is returning this weekend to a state that's part of her home territory - a place she's so well known her name adorns landmarks including the national airport and a children's library.

Such a barnstorming tour from Hillary Clinton seems unlikely in the state next year.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton returns to Arkansas, now behind GOP lines
entry.summary: Headlining this year's event, presidential hopeful Clinton returns to a state that looks dramatically different than the one where she served as first lady for a dozen years.

entry.title: Democratic activists still not quite ready for Clinton
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton listens to a question from a guest after a town hall meeting in Dover, N.H., Thursday, July 16, 2015.

entry.title: Democratic activists still not quite ready for Hillary Clinton's 2016 bid
entry.summary:
PHOENIX - Three months into Hillary Rodham Clinton's campaign for president, there are fresh warning signs she may be falling short with some Democratic voters whose enthusiasm will be essential to her success in 2016.

"I think a lot of people will talk themselves into thinking what a great president Hillary Clinton will be," said Jose Martinez Diaz, a 36-year-old Democratic digital organizer from Washington.

"I think a lot of people are tired of Hillary Clinton and want something new," said Kristen Millnick, who was among hundreds of activists started arriving at Netroots Nation on Thursday.

entry.title: Clinton proposes tax breaks for corporate profit-sharing
entry.summary: DOVER, N.H. (AP) - Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton proposed new incentives Thursday to encourage corporations to share profits with workers.

entry.title: Clinton proposes tax breaks for corporate profit-sharing
entry.summary: Clinton's "Rising Incomes, Sharing Profits" plan is part of an economic platform she unveiled this week that focused on boosting wages for middle class families.

entry.title: AP-GfK Poll: Clinton's standing falls among Democrats
entry.summary: Hillary Rodham Clinton's standing is falling among Democrats, and voters view her as less decisive and inspiring than when she launched her presidential campaign just three months ago, according to a new Associated Press-GfK poll.

entry.title: AP-GfK Poll: Clinton's standing falls among Democrats
How the AP-GfK poll on Hillary Clinton was conducted
entry.summary: The Associated Press-GfK poll on Hillary Rodham Clinton and the Republican candidates for president was conducted by GfK Public Affairs and Corporate Communications July 9-13.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton spends $18 million, hires hundreds
entry.summary: Hillary Rodham Clinton spent more than $18 million and hired hundreds of employees in the first three months of her presidential campaign, creating a national operation that vastly outpaces her rivals in both parties.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton spends $19 million, hires hundreds for early campaign
entry.summary: WASHINGTON - Hillary Rodham Clinton has spent nearly $19 million and has hired hundreds of staff during the first three months of her presidential campaign.

entry.title: Report: Clinton has spent 40% of campaign funds
entry.summary: Clinton campaign manager Robby Mook said thanks to their 250,000 donors, the campaign has "had the ability to make critical investments in our organization that will put us in position to win the primary and the White House."

entry.title: Bernie Sanders gets his say on Clinton's day in Capitol
Clinton backs Iran nuclear agreement as 'important step'
entry.summary:
Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton walks with House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi of Calif. on Capitol Hill in Washington, Tuesday, July 14, 2015.

Hillary Rodham Clinton praised the nuclear deal with Iran on Tuesday as an "important step," saying the agreement would end up "putting the lid on Iran's nuclear program."

entry.title: Hillary Clinton Backs Iran Nuclear Agreement
Hillary Clinton Slams Donald Trump in Spanish: ‘Basta!’
Hillary Clinton’s war on the sharing economy
Hillary Clinton Boosts Workers, Blasts Uber
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton speaks at The New School on Monday in New York City.

entry.title: American Federation of Teachers endorses Hillary Clinton
entry.summary:
"In vision, in experience and in leadership, Hillary Clinton is the champion working families need in the White House," AFT President Randi Weingarten said in a statement.

"Hillary Clinton is a tested leader who shares our values, is supported by our members, and is prepared for a tough fight on behalf of students, families and communities."

entry.title: American Federation of Teachers Endorses Hillary Clinton
Hillary Clinton to center campaign on raising middle-class incomes
entry.summary: Clinton plans to make boosting middle-class incomes and wages the focus of her presidential campaign's economic agenda.

entry.title: Clinton to outline steps to bolster middle class income in campaign economic speech on Monday
Hillary Clinton to Outline Economic Policy on Monday
Benghazi panel chair: Clinton subpoena claim inaccurate
entry.summary:
Gowdy said the committee issued the March 4 subpoena to Clinton personally after learning the full extent of her use of private emails while serving as secretary of state.

A committee statement on March 4 announced that it had issued subpoenas for "all communications of former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton related to Libya and to the State Department for other individuals who have information pertinent to the investigation."

entry.title: Hillary Clinton: 'People should and do trust me'
CNN to interview Hillary Clinton about her 2016 presidential campaign
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON - Hillary Rodham Clinton plans to give CNN her first one-on-one national television interview since launching her 2016 presidential campaign.

The network said on Monday the Clinton interview with CNN's Brianna Keilar will air Tuesday at 5 p.m. and again at 8 p.m. EDT.

entry.title: Hillary Clinton corrals the media
China downplays Hillary Clinton’s claim it hacked U.S. information
entry.summary:
China downplays Hillary Clinton's claim it hacked U.S. information Add to...

China on Monday downplayed an accusation by U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton that Beijing had tried to "hack into everything that doesn't move in America".
